name: sprint
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to run as fast as you can over a short distance, either in a race or because you are in a great hurry to get somewhere: We had to sprint to catch the bus.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to runrunShe saw him running down the street.sprintI had to sprint to catch the bus.jog"What do you do to keep fit?" "I jog and go swimming."raceHe raced up the stairs to answer the phone.rushEveryone rushed to the door when the alarm went off.dashHe dashed out the door after the dog.

Related word
sprinter
[ C ] a short and very fast race, such as the 100 metres, or the last part of a longer race that is run as fast as possible: the 100-metre sprint
[ S ] a very fast run that someone makes when they are in a great hurry to get somewhere: He suddenly broke into (= started) a sprint.

Add to word list
to run very fast esp. for a short distance, either as a competitor in a sport or because you are in a hurry to get somewhere: Clark sprinted past Smith and caught the ball in the end zone. He sprinted off to meet his girlfriend. sprinter noun [ C ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈsprɪn·tər/
Carl Lewis was a world-class sprinter for many years.
a short race run at full speed, or any short period of fast running
